intro: Ghinia mutica, commonly known as the sticky nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruits are small berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Ghinia mutica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
